results.title: Sharing the roads safely
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
investigates pedestrians, bicycles, domestic pets, and children as hazards for the driver. Suggests that accident-free driving for all vehicles sharing the road should be the aim for all people.

results.title: Sculpture Australia '69
results.brief_description: Australian sculptors discuss their attitudes towards modern sculpture. Artists shown at work include Norma Redpath creating the fountain for the Commonwealth Treasury, Steven Walker, Ken Reinhart, Robert Klippel, Clement Meadmore and Vincent Jomantis
results.description: Australian sculptors discuss their attitudes towards modern sculpture. Artists shown at work include Norma Redpath creating the fountain for the Commonwealth Treasury, Steven Walker, Ken Reinhart, Robert Klippel, Clement Meadmore and Vincent Jomantis

results.title: Sculpture
results.brief_description: Designed to show the power and beauty of some of Melbourne’s many sculptures from Dante in the Treasury Gardens to the striking figures of St George and the Dragon, and Joan of Arc in front of the State Library of Victoria. The effective soundtrack was arranged and played by Lenore Somerset.

results.title: School in the mailbox
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: By plane, train, buggy, bike, camel and car, school reaches the children of the Australian outback. Correspondence schooling is available for outback children from primary to high school standard, and for many Australians, the school lessons the mailman brings are the only ones they ever receive. Directed by Stanley Hawes, this documentary was produced in a remarkably short time and was sent to Paris as Australia’s contribution to the 1946 UNESCO conference. It was also nominated for an Academy Award for the best documentary short of 1947. Photographed by William Trerise, music by John Antill.

results.title: Rumpelstiltskin
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: One of a series of films in which puppets are used to interpret folk legends. This film is an adaptation of the well-known fairy tale of the miller’s daughter and the strange little man who spun straw into gold for her.

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Colour film record of the visit to Melbourne of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. The three crowded, exciting days are show in detail. Includes the arrival of Her Majesty, presentation of the cup at the races at Flemington, a glittering State reception, service at Scot’s Church, Myer Music Bowl concert, Moomba parade, waving to country children en route to open the Royal Children’s Hospital, investiture at Government House, and farewell at the wharf.
results.creator_credit_for_label: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: The Royal Silver Jubilee Exhibition Train
results.creator_credit: Michael Pearce, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at the Jubilee Exhibition train, housing 700 years of British history. Shows many of the exhibits and the stories behind them, and follows the progress of the train throughout Australia. Narrated by Stuart Wagstaff.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Pearce, Peter Johnson and Film Australia

results.title: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.

results.title: Rooftopics
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Views of Sydney Harbour, city and inner suburbs from the roof-tops of various buildings. Shows scenes of everyday activities, roof gardens, play-grounds, swimming pools, street traffic, etc. viewed from above. Includes humorous animated sequence involving a man, his towel and a woman beside a swimming pool. No spoken commentary. Edited by Wayne Le Clos; photographed by George Alexander; music by Eric Gross and script by Antonio Colacino.
